text: but I think of freedom I think of
walking out into my garden there's a
little gate into a small patch of
woodland I didn't look at the
wildflowers and the trees and bushes
that are along there and occasionally if
you're lucky listen to the birds as we
walk on in a song moment I went to Iraq
to meet Iraqi people and explain that
not everybody in Britain was in favor of
the war various visits were arranged for
us and after one of those visits we were
stopped by another car and out jumped
gunmen and in that way we were kidnapped
we were taken to a house and we were
handcuffed together day and night and
held in that house for three and a half
months
well the release was quite unexpected
first when you are about it was early in
the morning when the SAS came storming
up the staircase sniped through our
chains and led us downstairs and out
into the open air good evening the peace
activist Norman Kember is back home in
North London tonight after four months
being held hostage in Iraq after meeting
my wife at the airport we were driven
back here and I remember going through
the house and him into the garden
because that was my idea of being free
